page.title: 09 CAIRN GREG
page.content: One of the highest points in our area is{Cairnconan}where there once stood a building called Castle Greg or Gregory.A previous owner,named Gregory,was killed in a battle on the hill above Linlathen where a cairn was erected called Cairn-Greg.This cairn was opened in the presence of the late Mr Erskine of Linlathen.Tradition does not give details of the battle in the parish of Monifieth,nor give the date on which it was fought.It would have been interesting to be informed of these particulars.There is no doubt a person had been buried on the spot,and a cairn raised over it named Cairn-Greg.
